about.title: About SmartX
about.subtitle: Learn more about our mission to revolutionize personal technology.
about.foundedText: Founded in 2023, SmartX is redefining what a smartphone can be.

story.title: Our Story
story.content: SmartX was born from a simple question: Why can't our smartphones do more? Our team of engineers and designers set out to create a device that breaks the limitations of conventional smartphones, offering unprecedented customization and expandability.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: We're on a mission to empower users with technology that adapts to their unique needs, rather than forcing them to adapt to technology. SmartX is designed to evolve with you, offering endless possibilities for customization and expansion.

team.title: Our Team
team.content: Our diverse team brings together expertise from consumer electronics, software development, and hardware engineering. United by a passion for innovation, we're committed to pushing the boundaries of what's possible in personal technology.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about SmartX.

availability.question: When will SmartX be available?
availability.answer: SmartX will be available for pre-order through our Kickstarter campaign starting in Q3 2023. The first devices are expected to ship to backers in Q1 2024, with general availability planned for Q2 2024.

os.question: What operating system does SmartX run?
os.answer: SmartX runs on SmartOS, our custom-built operating system based on Android Open Source Project (AOSP) with modifications to support our unique hardware capabilities. It's fully compatible with Android apps while offering additional APIs for hardware expansion modules.

expansion.question: How does the microcontroller expansion work?
expansion.answer: SmartX features a proprietary expansion port on the back of the device that connects to our expansion modules via USB. Each module can contain various microcontrollers and components that extend the functionality of your device. We provide a comprehensive SDK for developers to create their own modules and software integrations.

payment.question: What payment processors are supported for Tap and Pay?
payment.answer: SmartX's Tap and Pay feature supports major payment processors including Stripe, Square, PayPal, and Adyen. We provide a developer API that allows integration with additional payment services. Our built-in POS software supports standard credit/debit cards, NFC payments, and popular mobile payment solutions.
